description: Example PRD showing proper story structure - Copy to prd.json and customize

stories.title: Add Bulk Fuel Entry CSV Upload
acceptanceCriteria: Create BulkFuelUpload component in src/components/fuel/
Support CSV file upload with drag-and-drop
Parse CSV with columns: date, gallons, price_per_gallon, state, truck_id
Validate data before inserting (required fields, valid dates, positive numbers)
Show preview table before confirming import
Display success/error summary after import
Auto-sync imported fuel entries to expenses via expenseFuelIntegration
Add 'Import CSV' button to fuel dashboard
stories.notes: Reference existing FuelEntryForm in src/components/fuel/ for patterns. Use Papa Parse for CSV parsing (already in dependencies).

stories.title: IFTA Quarterly Report PDF Export
acceptanceCriteria: Create IFTAReportPDF component using jsPDF
Match official IFTA quarterly report format
Include company information header
Show state-by-state mileage breakdown table
Calculate fuel tax owed/credit per state
Include summary totals section
Add 'Export PDF' button to IFTA dashboard
PDF filename should include quarter and year (e.g., IFTA_Q1_2026.pdf)
stories.notes: Use existing jsPDF patterns from invoice PDF generation. Reference iftaService.js for calculations.

stories.title: Driver Document Expiration Dashboard Widget
acceptanceCriteria: Create ExpiringDocumentsWidget component
Query all driver documents expiring in next 30 days
Display as card widget on main dashboard
Show document type, driver name, expiration date
Color-code: red (<7 days), yellow (7-14 days), orange (15-30 days)
Link to driver's document management page on click
Show empty state if no documents expiring soon
stories.notes: Reference complianceService.js for document queries. Add to dashboard layout.

stories.title: Expense Category Analytics Chart
acceptanceCriteria: Create ExpenseCategoryChart component using Recharts
Show pie/donut chart of expenses by category
Include date range filter (this month, last 3 months, this year)
Display category breakdown with amounts and percentages
Click on category to filter expense list
Add to expenses dashboard page
Handle empty state gracefully
stories.notes: Use Recharts (already installed). Reference dashboardService.js for expense aggregation patterns.

stories.title: Quick Add Load Modal
acceptanceCriteria: Create QuickAddLoadModal component
Minimal form: customer, pickup location, delivery location, rate
Auto-fill customer details from dropdown
Validate required fields before submit
Add floating action button to dashboard for quick access
Success toast notification after creation
Redirect to full load details page after creation
stories.notes: Use existing loadService.js for creation. Reference LoadForm component for field patterns.
